intro: Carex niko-montana, commonly known as the Niko-Montana sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, cylindrical flower clusters. Native to specific regions in Asia, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive foliage and ability to tolerate wet conditions. The plant plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
